item.title: Bombshell Suit Has 'GMA' Co-Hosts at Each Other's Throats, Sources Say...
item.description:
www.thedailybeast.com
Sources said a lawsuit accusing GMA’s former executive producer of sexual assault has opened a new rift between the show’s hosts and raised the anger of staffers demanding answers.

item.title: Russian cosmonauts find new cracks in ISS module...
item.description:
www.reuters.com
Russian cosmonauts have discovered new cracks in a segment of the International Space Station that could widen, a senior space official said on Monday, the latest in a series of setbacks.

item.title: Heavily armed criminal group ties hostages to getaway cars after laying siege to Brazilian city...
item.description:
www.msn.com
Even in a country long accustomed to random spasms of violence, Brazilians reacted with shock and fear.

item.title: New Zealand reports first death following PFIZER shot...
item.description:
thehill.com
New Zealand on Monday announced it had recorded its first death linked to Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine after a woman suffered from myocarditis, which is known to be a rare side effect of inflammation in the heart muscle.

item.title: Pentagon acknowledges reports of civilian casualties in U.S. drone strike...
item.description:
thehill.com
U.S. military officials are acknowledging reports of civilian casualties as the result of a drone strike on an explosives-laden vehicle carrying would-be suicide bombers in Kabul over the weekend.

item.title: Records rebut claims of unequal treatment of Jan. 6 rioters...
item.description:
apnews.com
It's a common refrain from some of those charged in the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol and their Republican allies: The Justice Department is treating them harshly because of their political views while those arrested during last year's protests over racial injustice were given leniency.

item.title: In defense of Elon Musk: 'Smartest person in any room anywhere'...
item.description:
www.theguardian.com
He’s the Silicon Valley Übermensch who wants us to colonise Mars and who can wipe out billions of dollars with a single tweet. So what’s not to love?

item.title: No cash or gas to run...
item.description:
apnews.com
Robert Owens felt defeated and helpless Sunday as he waited in Louisiana's capital city for landfall by one of the most powerful hurricanes ever to strike the U.S. The 27-year-old had spent days anxiously watching long lines of cars evacuating from Baton Rouge, bound for safer locations out of state as Hurricane Ida approached.

item.title: Israel doubles down on boosters as daily cases set new record...
item.description:
www.cnbc.com
Israeli lawmakers are keen to avoid another lockdown after overseeing one of the world's fastest vaccination drives.

item.title: People Trapped In Homes...
item.description:
dfw.cbslocal.com
Ida is now a tropical storm after spending 16 hours as a hurricane over Louisiana and Mississippi.

item.title: MCDONALD'S, others consider closing indoor seating...
item.description:
www.reuters.com
Some U.S. fast-food restaurants are closing indoor seating areas or limiting hours of operation because of the spread of the Delta variant of COVID-19, according to franchisees.

item.title: Catastrophic damage...
item.description:
www.cbsnews.com
Ida, which crashed ashore as an "extremely dangerous" Category 4 hurricane, is now a tropical storm but still packing a powerful punch. Louisiana has more than a million power outages.

item.title: Qatar emerges as key player...
item.description:
apnews.com
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Qatar played an outsized role in U.S. efforts to evacuate tens of thousands of people from Afghanistan. Now the tiny Gulf Arab state is being asked to help shape what is next for Afghanistan because of its ties with both Washington and the Taliban, who are in charge in Kabul.

item.title: Judge asked mother if she got vaccine. She said no, and he revoked custody of son...
item.description:
www.msn.com
Rebecca Firlit told a Chicago judge she didn't get the coronavirus vaccine because she's had bad reactions to vaccines in the past. The judge then revoked her custody until she's inoculated.

item.title: Humorless politics a sad sign of our times...
item.description:
thehill.com
When criticized for soaring deficits, Regan replied, “I am not worried about the deficit. It is big enough to take care of itself."

item.description:

The leader of an anti-mask movement in Texas has died from COVID-19.

item.title: Facing Weeks of Darkness...
item.description:
finance.yahoo.com
(Bloomberg) -- New Orleans may be without power and air conditioning for more than three weeks in the wake of Hurricane Ida, which roared ashore with more powerful winds than Hurricane Katrina, according to utility owner Entergy Corp.Almost 750,000 homes and businesses were without power across Louisiana as of 7:26 p.m. local time on Sunday, according to Poweroutage.us, which tracks utility outages. The blackouts were concentrated in the southeastern tip of the state that includes New Orleans an

item.description:
news.trust.org
STORM-IDA/LEVEES (PIX):New Orleans' levees got a $14.5 billion upgrade. Will they hold?

item.title: Hospitals brimming with virus patients...
item.description:
apnews.com
NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Southern Lousiana's hospitals, already packed with coronavirus patients from a fourth surge of the virus, were dealing Sunday with another challenge — the howling Category 4 hurricane pounding the coast.

item.title: Wind, storm surge from Hurricane Ida lash Louisiana...
item.description:
apnews.com
NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Hurricane Ida blasted ashore Sunday as one of the most powerful storms ever to hit the U.S., blowing off roofs and reversing the flow of the Mississippi River as it rushed from the Louisiana coast toward New Orleans and one of the nation’s most important industrial corridors.

item.title: Hostile school board meetings have members calling it quits...
item.description:
apnews.com
A Nevada school board member said he had thoughts of suicide before stepping down amid threats and harassment. In Virginia, a board member resigned over what she saw as politics driving decisions on masks.

item.title: Weather heats up as California fire inches toward Lake Tahoe...
item.description:
apnews.com
SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif. (AP) — Spiking temperatures and increasing winds on Sunday added to the challenges faced by firefighters battling blazes across Northern California, including one that continued its march toward the Lake Tahoe resort region.

item.title: Record onslaught of landfalls...
item.description:
apnews.com
In the past two years, hurricanes have been brewing, strengthening and hitting the United States at a record pace, and Ida will likely go down as one of the nastiest of a dangerous bunch. While not quite record-setting, Ida is among some of strongest and fastest intensifying storms in more than 150 years of hurricane records.

item.title: Drone kills ISIS targeting airport...
item.description:
apnews.com
KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — A U.S. drone strike blew up a vehicle carrying “multiple suicide bombers” from Afghanistan's Islamic State affiliate on Sunday before they could attack the ongoing military evacuation at Kabul's international airport, American officials said.

item.title: Biden attends grim homecoming for troops killed in Afghanistan...
item.description:
apnews.com
DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del. (AP) — In hushed reverence, President Joe Biden stood witness with grieving families Sunday under a gray sky as, one by one, the remains of 13 U.S. troops killed in the Kabul suicide bombing were removed with solemnity from a military aircraft that brought them home.

item.title: Parts of country running out of oxygen...
item.description:
www.wdsu.com
With the continued uptick in COVID-19 cases, there has been more demand on the oxygen supply, and hospitals cannot keep up the pace to meet those needs, an expert says.

item.title: REPORT: Powerful Rocket Explosion Hits Home...
item.description:
www.businessinsider.com
A rocket has hit a house near Kabul airport, say sources inside the Afghan capital. A child was killed.

item.title: Miss. Gov.: South's response impacted by belief in 'eternal life'...
item.description:
dailymemphian.com
Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves talked about the pandemic Thursday, Aug. 26, at a re-election fundraiser in Shelby County held at a replica of the Mississippi governor’s mansion.

item.title: Tehran thieves attack car, steal shots...
item.description:
apnews.com
TEHRAN, Iran — The police chief for Iran’s capital says a gang of thieves has robbed scores of COVID-19 vaccines after attacking a hired car carrying the doses, media reported. The robbery comes as Iran, with over 106,000 virus-related deaths, has the highest death toll in the Mideast but only 8% of its people are fully vaccinated.
